div.l: With buttokis brode and brestis round ⁊and hiȝe
But ful feir was hir heer I wol nat ly
The persone of the town for she was feir
In purpose was to make her͗e his heyre
Both of Catell and eke of messuage
And straunge he made it for hir mariage
His purpose was to be stow hir͗e hiȝe
Into som worthy blood of Auncetry
For holy chichis goodis must be dispendit
On holy chirch blood that is discendit
Therfor he wold his holy blood honour͗e
Thouȝe he holy chirch shuld devour͗e
Grete socour hath this Miller out of dowte
With whete ⁊and malt of al the lond a bowte
And namely ther͗e was a grete colage
Men callit it the soler hall at Cambrigg
Ther͗e was hir whete ⁊and hir malt I ground
And eke on a day it happid in a stounde
Sike lay the mancipill on a malady
Men went verely that he shuld dy
For wich this Millere stole both whete ⁊and corn
An hundrit tyme more þen he did to forn
For theretofore he stale but curteysly
But now he was a theff uttirly
For wich the warden chid ⁊and made fare
But there of set he nat a tare
He crakid boost and seid it was nat so
Ther͗e were ther͗e pore scolers too
That dwellid in that hall of wich I sey
Testyff they were and lusty to pley
Oppon the warden bysely they cry
To gyve hem leve but litill stounde
To go to the Mill and se hir corn I ground
And hardely they durst ley hir͗e nek
The Miller shuld nat stele fro them a pek
Of corn by scleyȝt ne hem be reve
